Articles.Content:
Sorry in advance for my noobishness at this game, and my inexperience.

So, I was having a good play session when I went to space centre after a flight via the Space Centre button that comes out at the top of the screen, and wanted to visit the Tracking Station, however much I clicked on it, it did not open. I have a video of that happening. I also (in the video too) tried to go into the VAB and SPH, both of which did not work either. I could however load the crafts that I have made by selecting the Launchpad, or Runway, but again when I tried to launch them it would close the list and then do nothing. I closed the game, restarted it, restarted it by just running the .exe instead of the launcher, I tried loading both the Launcher and the .exe file while running in administrator, all of which did not resolve the problem. I have yet to try the patcher or a reinstall, which I am not a particular fan of. Is there anything I can do? Luckily I have a running youtube channel and below is a video of the problem. This was recorded with Fraps which was opened after the game was run and I know the problem if it is run before but the problem occured before. Additionally, after I went and hired a new astronaut, hovering over the buildings suddenly didn't work. Is this a corrupt game?

http://youtu.be/rrGO3VkEF8Y

Edited December 30, 2014 by Spitfiredzwww
Additional Info

Sounds a bit like this issue - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/103205-0-90-Career-has-entered-a-state-where-menu-building-options-are-not-responsive - that a few people have posted regarding the game getting stuck if kerbals who have gained game achievements are fired or die.

Have a read of that one, maybe it will have a pointer or two. I assume if you load a different save game it works and its only this save that has the problem?

Yeah, I agree with Trigger. You've likely killed or saved a kerbal who logged an achievement or that was rescued from orbit. I've created an add-on that helps stop this problem (if you aren't opposed to using them), but you'll need to still manually fix the save game first. My fix only prevents it, but can't fix a broken save.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/97285-KSP-v0-90-Stock-Bug-Fix-Modules-%28Release-v0-1-7b-29-Dec-14%29

To fix your save, you'll need to manually edit the save file. You'll then need to find either the achievement (under the title "ProgressTracking") or find the contract that references a kerbal (or kerbals) that are not longer listed in the roster at the end of the save file.

If you want more specific directions, you can post a save file and we can tell you exactly where to fix it.

Cheers,

~Claw

Ok I see the problems the others were having but I am playing in Sandbox Mode and had recently killed Jeb in a mission, and when I came back, and recovered the vessel nothing seemed to work. I think I also clicked X on jeb in the Missing in Action tab, which I think caused the problem. I am 'remaking' Jebediah Kerman in the Persistence.sfs by adding this in:

KERBAL

{

name = Jebedian Kerman

type = Crew

brave = 0.5

dumb = 0.5

badS = True

state = Available

ToD = 0

idx = 1

CAREER_LOG

{

flight = 1

0 = Orbit,Kerbin

0 = ExitVessel,Kerbin

0 = BoardVessel,Kerbin

0 = Suborbit,Kerbin

0 = Flight,Kerbin

0 = Land,Kerbin

0 = Recover

}

FLIGHT_LOG

{

flight = 1

}

}

- - - Updated - - -

Hooray!!! Adding Jebediah back to the Crew Roster in the Astronaut complex has officially solved the problem! Thank you all!

Also, is there a way to mark this thread as solved?
